alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 24 at 12:09PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible this afternoon and evening. * WHERE...Portions of north central and west central New Mexico, including the following areas, in north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Jemez Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. In west central New Mexico, Southwest Mountains. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall may lead to excessive runoff over recent wildfire burn scars such as the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon, Cooks Peak, Cerro Pelado, Bear Trap and Black burn scars. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Wildfire burn scars have already received heavy rainfall over the past few days and will be especially vulnerable to excessive runoff and flash flooding. - https://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains
